intro: Relhania affinis, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit or yellow starfruit, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Atlantic rainforests of Brazil and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are often used in local cuisines. Relhania affinis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
